reasoning: Retinitis Pigmentosa 28 is a rare genetic subtype of retinitis pigmentosa. Using prevalence (~1 per 100k) as this is a chronic genetic disorder. Limited epidemiological data available specifically for RP28; confidence reflects rare subtype status.
source: Verbakel SK et al. (2018). Non-syndromic retinitis pigmentosa. Prog Retin Eye Res. 66:157-186
